thread.title: Massive Attack announce 2016 tour, and fans are very excited
thread.title_full: Massive Attack announce 2016 tour, and fans are very excited

title: Massive Attack announce 2016 tour, and fans are very excited
text:
Massive Attack announce 2016 tour, and fans are very excited Massive Attack announce 2016 tour, and fans are very excited Share 
Massive Attack have revealed details of their first UK tour in over five years. 
Bristol duo Robert “3D” Del Naja and Grant “Daddy G” Marshall will play nine gigs around the country throughout January and February 2016, which includes two shows at London’s Brixton O2 Academy. http://t.co/RXznvpwEZQ 2016 tour dates announced. 
— Massive Attack (@MassiveAttackUK) October 6, 2015 
This will be Massive Attack’s first standalone headline tour in over five years, and will also include dates in Glasgow, Leicester, Leeds, Manchester, Birmingham, Portsmouth and Brighton. 
Support will come from Scottish trio Young Fathers. 
The pair also revealed they are releasing a new album later this year, which comes five years after Heligoland in 2010. Massive Attack (PA) 
Pre-sale tickets for the UK shows are available now from www.massiveattack.com before tickets are available at 9am on October 9. 
The news has already become a trending topic on Twitter, as fans express their excitement over the upcoming shows. Massive Attack are back. This makes me happier than words can say. 
— Jamie Bellinger (@JamieBellinger) October 6, 2015 Seeing Massive Attack trend on Twitter pleases me greatly. There are folk who have good taste in music. https://t.co/I4H0ZHLUhG 
— Sarah Robertson (@SarahRobertson5) October 6, 2015 I'm basically from Bristol(near enough). I grew up with Massive Attack. Such a band, I can't wait for @olympiatheatre date. @mcd_productions 
— James Hendicott (@jameshendicott) October 6, 2015 massive attack is dropping new music?!?! this day is kind of lit already. 
— neil mccauley (@the_blueprint) October 6, 2015 Massive Attack trending on twitter means, at this moment, everything is right with the world. 
— Adam Azor (@AdamAzor) October 6, 2015 MASSIVE ATTACK ARE TOURING AND I HAVE NOBODY TO GO WITH PLS SOMEONE COME WITH ME
